name: Jesmond Hotel

reviews.text: Last December I decided to book a room for me and my friends because all of the good reviews I had seen on TripAdvisor.
reviews.title: Will not stay anywhere else, go Jesmond!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was New Year's Eve time and I was afraid that it would cost us a fortune and we would be sleeping in a noisy room or something...But it was nothing like that!!!
reviews.title: Delighted with our stay at the Jesmond

reviews.text: The reservation was quick to make (every question we had about the rooms and the facilities were quickly answered...) and on the 30th of December there we were.
reviews.title: Pleasant and relaxing atmosphere

reviews.text: The location is awsome. Bus 24 (I think...) takes you to Oxford Street, Trafalguar Square, Picadilly... all in 10 minutes. It couldn't be more central.
reviews.title: Dont listen to the others, the Jesmond is great!

likes.liked: — Location was great! Service was friendly! Food was hot and great as well!
likes.disliked: — internet room closed at 10, no lift to go upstairs-but it was still fine to go up and down the stairs

reviews.text: The rooms are fine. They are not luxury but we paid so little that it is amazing what we got in exchange. We had three different rooms to fulfill our "essential needs" - one with toilet and bath, one with only a toilet and one with a shower. Never waited to use any of them!
reviews.title: Service okay, but beware room size!

likes.disliked: — The room I was initially put in.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Jesmond Hotel has more of a small hotel feel than a B&B. The rooms and common area were spotless! The family that runs the hotel was polite, but rather reserved, not a lot of chit chat. The location in Bloomsbury is very convenient and about a 15-20 minute walk from Trafalgar Square. Lots of restaurants and pubs nearby, and the British Musuem is also close enough to walk to. Breakfast is served each morning with a choice of a traditional English breakfast (eggs, ham, beans) or cereal. The only downside to this hotel would be for an elderly or disabled person. Although we were in room 8 on the 2nd floor, this required a climb of 4 flights of rather steep stairs. Also, breakfast is served in the basement which requires additional stairs. If you're somewhat fit, I would absolutely recommend the Jesmond.
reviews.title: Did not disappoint!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After reading a lot of reviews on TripAdvisor about B&B Hotels in London we chose the Jesmond as it had the most positive reviews. Being Italian, and therefore a little fussier than normal, we expected to find a little less and a little worse than what we had read but in fact it was quite the opposite. The location were great, so much so that we moved about on foot most of the time. The rooms were clean, adequately spacious and well-equipped. We asked for a room on the 2nd floor with a view of the back garden and that is exactly what we got! Our bed was very comfortable, the room had plenty of space (as B&B go) for moving about and leaving the occasional thing on the floor without blocking everyone's way. The toilet was the best part: tiled from top to bottom (even the roof was tiled!), with a great shower that had none of those electric things where you pull the cord and the water gets hot -- it was real boiler-hot water! And even the pressure from the taps, as read in the reviews, was high and nice. Service was discrete but excellent, as was the full English breakfast we had every morning. I have only praise for this hotel, in fact I think I will use it as a base for my short trips to London.
reviews.title: Every bit as good as the best reviews

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: let's face it.
reviews.title: what more do you want in a hotel in zone one?

reviews.text: It's about 15 minutes walk from the tube, but it's still very convenient.
reviews.title: Lovely B & B and very affordable

reviews.text: 5 minutes walk to the British Museum, what more do you want?
reviews.title: Didn't feel welcome

reviews.text: I had 3 requirements when booking a hotel in London. I wanted a central location, en-suite bathroom and breakfast. The Jesmond Hotel more than filled my requirements.
reviews.title: Nice, family atmosphere.

reviews.text: From the moment I checked in until I left, I felt very welcome. It seemed like I was staying at a friend's house.
reviews.title: Great Value

reviews.text: The rooms are small, but I spent so little time in my hotel room that it did not make a difference. I had room #3 facing the garden. There was very little street noise on this side of the hotel. My bathroom was extremely clean and the towels were changed daily. There was good water pressure and plenty of hot water. Although the hotel is not air-conditioned, the cool nights and the room fan made the room comfortable.
reviews.title: great position in london

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The English breakfast was cooked to perfection by the wonderful staff. The breakfast was substantial enough to take me through most of the day.
reviews.title: Good value, good location, clean, friendly

reviews.text: I will definitely stay at this hotel again.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel

reviews.text: We were delighted to discover this hotel in central London. Fantastic location.Spotlessley clean. Excellent breakfast.In particular the staff were all very friendly
reviews.title: What a find!

reviews.text: and could not do enough for us.
reviews.title: Good location,rooms fine,breakfast fine

reviews.text: We had a quad room on the front and unlike previous comments were not bothered by noise whatsoever. The only criticism I would make is that the room was far too hot and it did not seem possible to control the heat from the room.
reviews.title: Good Value

reviews.text: We will most definitely return. The hotel added to the whole enjoyable experience of introducing our children to London for the first time. Thank you to The Jesmond!
reviews.title: Excellent Value in the Heart of London

reviews.text: We stayed in a quad room street level in the front of the hotel. The room had en suite bath which was small but adequate and clean.The beds( three twins and a couch) could use new bedding .Street noise was a big problem for the first two or three nights. I'd recommend a room in the back of the hotel . The staff was very helpful and the hotel clean .Overall a good value.
reviews.title: Everything I needed!

description: Are you looking for a budget hotel in London? We welcome you to the Jesmond Hotel, a family-run, friendly bed and breakfast hotel in the centre of London. The Jesmond Hotel has been established and run by the Beynon family for over 30 years and we aim to provide friendly, affordable, hotel accommodation for all of our guests. We pride ourselves on the many guests that return to us year after year.
